pyhpeimc.auth module¶

class pyhpeimc.auth.IMCAuth(h_url, server, port, username, password)[source]¶

Bases: requests.auth.HTTPDigestAuth

This class handles authentication against the HPE IMC API and uses the Requests API. IMCAuth derives from requests.auth.HTTPDigestAuth.

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.204", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> auth.password
'admin'
get_auth()[source]¶

This method requests an authentication object from the HPE IMC NMS and returns an HTTPDigest Auth Object :return:

pyhpeimc.auth.print_to_file(object)[source]¶

Function takes in object of type str, list, or dict and prints out to current working directory as pyoutput.txt :param: Object: object of type str, list, or dict :return: No return. Just prints out to file handler and save to current working directory as pyoutput.txt

pyhpeimc.auth.set_imc_creds(h_url=None, imc_server=None, imc_port=None, imc_user=None, imc_pw=None)[source]¶

This function prompts user for IMC server information and credentuials and stores values in url and auth global variables

pyhpeimc.auth.test_imc_creds(auth, url)[source]¶

Function takes input of auth class object auth object and URL and returns a BOOL of TRUE if the authentication was successful.

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> test_imc_creds(auth.creds, auth.url)
True
